intro: Pedicularis chenocephala, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that resemble small monkeys, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous regions of China. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
